sen.j: 楠木 行康（くすのき ゆきやす）は室町時代の武将。
sen.e: Yukiyasu KUSUNOKI was a busho (Japanese military commander) in Muromachi period.

sen.j: 楠木正成、楠木正行の直系の子孫とされる。
sen.e: He is said to be a direct descendant of Masashige KUSUNOKI and Masatsura KUSUNOKI.

sen.j: 長禄の変で神器奪回を目指す赤松氏遺臣に敗れ、父の正理は討ち死に。
sen.e: In the Choroku Conspiracy, his father Masamichi was killed by surviving retainer of Akamatsu clan who aimed for recapture of Sacred Treasures of the Imperial Family.

sen.e: In the Choroku Conspiracy, his father Masamichi was killed by surviving retainers of Akamatsu clan who aimed for recapture of the Sacred Treasures of the Imperial Family.

sen.j: 行康も膝を負傷し、熊野に逃れた（この時自刃したとも）。
sen.e: Yukiyasu too, injured his knee and fled to Kumano (some says that he committed suicide at the time).
Wounded in his knee, Yukiyasu fled to Kumano, too (some say that he committed suicide at that time).
sen.cmt: 「行康も」は「逃れた」にかかると思われましたので、tooの位置を文末に変えました。injured his kneeよりをwounded in his kneeのほうが適当だと思われます。saysをsayにしました。 at that timeをat that timeにしました。
sen.e: Wounded in his knee, Yukiyasu fled to Kumano, too (some say that he committed suicide at that time).

sen.j: 子に楠木正俊がいたとされ、子孫は後に楠氏と称している。
sen.e: He had a son, Masatoshi KUSUNOKI and later his descendant used 楠 (Kusunoki) for their name, not 楠木 (Kusunoki) (Kusunoki clan(氏): 楠木氏 > 楠氏).

It is said that among his children was Masatoshi KUSUNOKI, and later his descendants as the Kusunoki clan used 楠 (Kusunoki) for their family name, omitting the second letter "木" from the original "楠木".
sen.cmt: 意味を明確にするため全文を書き換えました。
